metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13543 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A code execution vulnerability exists in the WebSocket functionality of Webkit WebKitGTK 2.30.0. A specially crafted web page can trigger a use-after-free vulnerability which can lead to remote code execution. An attacker can get a user to visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
